text: Osawatomie is a city in Miami County, Kansas, United States. it is southwest of Kansas City. In 2020, 4,255 people lived there. Its name is a portmanteau from two streams nearby, the Osage and Potawatomie. ==Geography== Osawatomie is at (38.501650, -94.950799), along the Marais des Cygnes River. The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ==People== ===2020 census=== The census of 2020 says there were 4,255 people, 1,562 households, and 1,023 families living in the city. Of the households, 55.3% owned their home and 44.7% rented their home. The median age was 36.1 years. Of the people, 87.4% were White, 3.2% were Black, 1.0% were Native American, 0.4% were Asian, 0.1% were Pacific Islanders, 0.9% were from some other race, and 7.1% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were4.3% of the people. ===2010 census=== The census of 2010 says there were 4,447 people, 1,644 households, and 1,075 families living in the city. ==Government== The Osawatomie government has a mayor and eight council members. The council meets the 2nd and 4th Thursday of each month at 6:30PM.Osawatomie - Directory of Public Officials ==References== Category:Cities in Miami County, Kansas
title: Osawatomie, Kansas
